DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Patient Tobacco Use Questionnaire 3 How Old When First Began Smoking Cigarettes Regularly Year Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of their age when they first began smoking cigarettes regularly.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cancer Patient Tobacco Use Questionnaire How Old When First Began Smoking Cigarettes Regularly
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire developed for the baseline and longitudinal assessment of tobacco use in the cancer setting. Domains include cigarette smoking history and current use, use relative to cancer diagnosis and treatment, other tobacco product use, cessation, and second-hand exposure._A question about how old an individual was when they first began smoking cigarettes regularly.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire developed for the baseline and longitudinal assessment of tobacco use in the cancer setting. Domains include cigarette smoking history and current use, use relative to cancer diagnosis and treatment, other tobacco product use, cessation, and second-hand exposure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
Determining the number or amount of something.

ReferenceDocuments.name: How old were you when you fir
ReferenceDocuments.description: How old were you when you first began smoking cigarettes regularly?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value sets in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these CDEs.
